data.title: AGMP Presents: The Long Ryders
data.meta_description: The Long Ryders were formed in Los Angeles in the early 1980s and originally associated with a movement sometimes called the Paisley Underground.
data.text:
“They unwittingly invented Americana but seldom receive credit for it” Mojo Magazine

“Few Bands have made more of an impact on the current musical scene” Classic Rock Magazine

The founders of alt-country, The Long Ryders, announce a rare Liverpool gig at The Cavern Club!

The Long Ryders were formed in Los Angeles in the early 1980s and originally associated with a movement sometimes called the Paisley Underground. With a sound reminiscent of Gram Parsons-era Byrds, Buffalo Springfield and The Flying Burrito Brothers, but with a harder edge, they anticipated the alternative country music of the 1990s by a decade.

The Live Lounge is a standing venue with some unreserved seating. Seating is not guaranteed and may not be available for all shows. If you have a disability and need a seat please call us on 0151 236 1965 in advance to make arrangements!

Most events are 18 yrs and over please see our age policy for more information before booking. If you have any questions please get in touch with us.
